template.name: Template OS Linux SNMPv2
template.description: Template OS Linux version: 0.15 MIBs used: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB UCD-SNMP-MIB

item.name: Number of CPUs
item.description: MIB: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB Count the number of CPU cores by counting number of cores discovered in hrProcessorTable using LLD

step.params: //count the number of cores return JSON.parse(value).length;

item.name: Memory (buffers)
item.description: MIB: UCD-SNMP-MIB Memory used by kernel buffers (Buffers in /proc/meminfo)

item.name: Memory (cached)
item.description: MIB: UCD-SNMP-MIB Memory used by the page cache and slabs (Cached and Slab in /proc/meminfo)

item.name: Total memory
item.description: MIB: UCD-SNMP-MIB Total memory in Bytes

item.name: Available memory
item.description: Available memory, in Linux, available = free + buffers + cache. On other platforms calculation may vary. See also: https://www.zabbix.com/documentation/current/manual/appendix/items/vm.memory.size_params

item.name: Total swap space
item.description: MIB: UCD-SNMP-MIB The total amount of swap space configured for this host.

item.name: Free swap space
item.description: MIB: UCD-SNMP-MIB The amount of swap space currently unused or available.

discovery_rule.name: CPU discovery
discovery_rule.description: This discovery will create set of per core CPU metrics from UCD-SNMP-MIB, using {#CPUNUM} in preprocessing.\n That's the only reason why LLD is used.

item_prototype.name: CPU idle time
item_prototype.description: MIB: UCD-SNMP-MIB The time the CPU has spent doing nothing.

step.params: //to get utilization in %, divide by N, where N is number of cores. return value/{#CPUNUM}

item_prototype.name: CPU system time
item_prototype.description: MIB: UCD-SNMP-MIB The time the CPU has spent running the kernel and its processes.

step.params: //to get utilization in %, divide by N, where N is number of cores. return value/{#CPUNUM}

item_prototype.name: CPU user time
item_prototype.description: MIB: UCD-SNMP-MIB The time the CPU has spent running users' processes that are not niced.

step.params: //to get utilization in %, divide by N, where N is number of cores. return value/{#CPUNUM}

item_prototype.name: CPU steal time
item_prototype.description: MIB: UCD-SNMP-MIB The amount of CPU 'stolen' from this virtual machine by the hypervisor for other tasks (such as running another virtual machine).

step.params: //to get utilization in %, divide by N, where N is number of cores. return value/{#CPUNUM}

item_prototype.name: CPU softirq time
item_prototype.description: MIB: UCD-SNMP-MIB The amount of time the CPU has been servicing software interrupts.

step.params: //to get utilization in %, divide by N, where N is number of cores. return value/{#CPUNUM}

item_prototype.name: CPU nice time
item_prototype.description: MIB: UCD-SNMP-MIB The time the CPU has spent running users' processes that have been niced.

step.params: //to get utilization in %, divide by N, where N is number of cores. return value/{#CPUNUM}

item_prototype.name: CPU iowait time
item_prototype.description: MIB: UCD-SNMP-MIB Amount of time the CPU has been waiting for I/O to complete.

step.params: //to get utilization in %, divide by N, where N is number of cores. return value/{#CPUNUM}

item_prototype.name: CPU interrupt time
item_prototype.description: MIB: UCD-SNMP-MIB The amount of time the CPU has been servicing hardware interrupts.

step.params: //to get utilization in %, divide by N, where N is number of cores. return value/{#CPUNUM}

item_prototype.name: CPU guest time
item_prototype.description: MIB: UCD-SNMP-MIB Guest time (time spent running a virtual CPU for a guest operating system)

step.params: //to get utilization in %, divide by N, where N is number of cores. return value/{#CPUNUM}

item_prototype.name: CPU guest nice time
item_prototype.description: MIB: UCD-SNMP-MIB Time spent running a niced guest (virtual CPU for guest operating systems under the control of the Linux kernel)

step.params: //to get utilization in %, divide by N, where N is number of cores. return value/{#CPUNUM}
//count the number of CPU cores return JSON.stringify([{"{#CPUNUM}": value, "{#SNMPINDEX}": 0}])

item_prototype.name: {#SNMPVALUE}: Storage units
item_prototype.description: MIB: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB The size, in bytes, of the data objects allocated from this pool. If this entry is monitoring sectors, blocks, buffers, or packets, for example, this number will commonly be greater than one. Otherwise this number will typically be one.

item_prototype.name: {#SNMPVALUE}: Used storage in units
item_prototype.description: MIB: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB The amount of the storage represented by this entry that is allocated, in units of hrStorageAllocationUnits.

item_prototype.name: {#SNMPVALUE}: Total space in units
item_prototype.description: MIB: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB The size of the storage represented by this entry, in units of hrStorageAllocationUnits. This object is writable to allow remote configuration of the size of the storage area in those cases where such an operation makes sense and is possible on the underlying system. For example, the amount of main storage allocated to a buffer pool might be modified or the amount of disk space allocated to virtual storage might be modified.

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template OS Linux SNMPv2:vfs.fs.pused[storageUsedPercentage.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}>{$STORAGE_UTIL_CRIT:"{#SNMPVALUE}"} and (({Template OS Linux SNMPv2:vfs.fs.total[storageTotal.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}-{Template OS Linux SNMPv2:vfs.fs.used[storageUsed.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()})<5G or {Template OS Linux SNMPv2:vfs.fs.pused[storageUsedPercentage.{#SNMPINDEX}].timeleft(1h,,100)}<1d)
trigger_prototype.name: {#SNMPVALUE}: Disk space critical status
trigger_prototype.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. Space used: {ITEM.VALUE3} of {ITEM.VALUE2} ({ITEM.VALUE1}), time left till full: < 24h. Two conditions should match: First, space utilization should be above {$STORAGE_UTIL_CRIT:"{#SNMPVALUE}"}. Second condition should be one of the following: - Disk free space is less than 5G. - Disk will be full in less than 24hours.

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template OS Linux SNMPv2:vfs.fs.pused[storageUsedPercentage.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}>{$STORAGE_UTIL_WARN:"{#SNMPVALUE}"} and (({Template OS Linux SNMPv2:vfs.fs.total[storageTotal.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}-{Template OS Linux SNMPv2:vfs.fs.used[storageUsed.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()})<10G or {Template OS Linux SNMPv2:vfs.fs.pused[storageUsedPercentage.{#SNMPINDEX}].timeleft(1h,,100)}<1d)
trigger_prototype.name: {#SNMPVALUE}: Disk space warning
trigger_prototype.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. Space used: {ITEM.VALUE3} of {ITEM.VALUE2} ({ITEM.VALUE1}), time left till full: < 24h. Two conditions should match: First, space utilization should be above {$STORAGE_UTIL_CRIT:"{#SNMPVALUE}"}. Second condition should be one of the following: - Disk free space is less than 10G. - Disk will be full in less than 24hours.

dependency.name: {#SNMPVALUE}: Disk space critical status
dependency.expression: {Template OS Linux SNMPv2:vfs.fs.pused[storageUsedPercentage.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}>{$STORAGE_UTIL_CRIT:"{#SNMPVALUE}"} and (({Template OS Linux SNMPv2:vfs.fs.total[storageTotal.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}-{Template OS Linux SNMPv2:vfs.fs.used[storageUsed.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()})<5G or {Template OS Linux SNMPv2:vfs.fs.pused[storageUsedPercentage.{#SNMPINDEX}].timeleft(1h,,100)}<1d)

trigger.name: High swap space usage (free: {ITEM.VALUE1}, total: {ITEM.VALUE2})
trigger.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. This trigger is ignored, if there is no swap configured
